articles.author: Takahiko Wada, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Core inflation in Japan's capital slowed in September for the third straight month mainly on falling fuel costs, data showed on Friday, suggesting that cost-push pressures are starting to peak in a relief for the fragile economic recovery.
articles.title: Inflation in Japan's capital slows but pressures persist

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A U.S. civil rights agency sued Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) on Thursday, claiming the electric carmaker has tolerated severe harassment of Black employees at its flagship Fremont, California, assembly plant.
articles.title: Tesla sued by US agency over alleged harassment of Black factory workers

articles.author: David Shepardson, Joseph White
articles.description: The United Auto Workers made a new counter-proposal to Chrysler-parent Stellantis on Thursday, just one day before the union is set to strike additional Detroit Three automotive facilities without serious progress in ongoing labor negotiations.
articles.title: UAW makes new counter proposal to Chrysler parent Stellantis -union

articles.author: Deborah Sophia, Katherine Masters
articles.description: Nike (NKE.N) topped Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday as higher prices of its sneakers and apparel helped offset a hit from waning demand and persistent cost pressures, sending its shares up about 8% in extended trading.
articles.title: Nike beats profit estimates, pledges to boost focus on running shoes

articles.author: Katya Golubkova
articles.description: Oil prices fell in early trade on Friday after a recent rally, as profit-taking and expectations of supply increases by Russia and Saudi Arabia outweighed forecasts of positive demand from China during its Golden Week holiday.
articles.title: Oil prices fall as Russia, Saudi Arabia expected to boost supply

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "Fortnite" maker Epic Games is laying off about 830 employees, or 16% of its staff, and divesting online music platform Bandcamp, the company said on Thursday.
articles.title: Epic Games is laying off about 830 employees, divesting Bandcamp

articles.author: Marc Frank
articles.description: Power blackouts in Cuba are expected to increase significantly due to a lack of fuel, officials warned in a nationwide TV broadcast, worsening the country's plight as it deals with food and medicine shortages.
articles.title: Cuba warns of worsening blackouts as fuel crisis bites

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A New York appeals court on Thursday refused to delay Donald Trump's scheduled Oct. 2 civil fraud trial, after the former U.S. president accused the trial judge of wrongly refusing to throw out most of the case.
articles.title: Appeals court will not delay Donald Trump civil fraud trial

articles.author: David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The Democratic-led U.S. Senate forged ahead on Thursday with a bipartisan stopgap funding bill aimed at averting a fourth partial government shutdown in a decade, while the House prepared to vote on partisan Republican spending bills with no chance of becoming law.
articles.title: Shutdown odds grow as Senate, House advance separate spending plans

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Two senior U.S. and Chinese diplomats met in Washington and held what the U.S. side described as "candid, in-depth, and constructive consultation," the latest in a series of recent talks to keep lines of communication open between the world's two largest economies.
articles.title: Senior US, China diplomats meet in Washington in latest effort to maintain dialogue
